node.title: How science has turned HIV into a treatable, preventable condition
node.alt: Man stands in red World Aids day top smiling
node.description: In just half a lifetime, modern science has turned HIV, one of the most fearsome diseases in human history, into a treatable, preventable condition.
node.content:
["In just half a lifetime, modern science has turned HIV, one of the most fearsome diseases in human history, into a treatable, preventable condition.", "It's a medical marvel that HIV-positive Ruan Uys is reminded of every day.", "\"I wouldn't be here popping just one pill a day if it wasn't for the people who became HIV positive in the eighties,\" Mr Ruan said.", "\"They put their bodies on the line. They trialled new drugs. Blood, sweat, and tears were put into me being able to be here today.\"", "He was born in 1981 \u2013 in the very same year the virus began to spread rapidly.", "He was diagnosed with HIV in 2014.", "Even though treatment options were well advanced by then, the moment he found out his status hit him hard.", "\"The memories of those ads of people dying were really imprinted on my mind. I didn't know about treatments when I got my diagnosis. I thought, 'is this the end?'\" he said.", "The\u00a0HIV activist, who is\u00a0program coordinator with Bobby Goldsmith Foundation\u00a0and the founder of HIVsters, said he felt a lot of internalised shame.", "\"I had a lot of internalised shame and stigma that I was carrying within myself.", "\"I was uneducated. I was just sort of trying to stay away from everyone because if I hung out with friends, it would invariably come out, or I'd say something, and then I'd have to deal with that.\"", "It's a trauma John Rule understands. He was diagnosed with HIV in 1996.", "\"I think it's a common experience for people who are diagnosed with HIV to have a traumatic response to that diagnosis,\" said Mr Rule,\u00a0a senior research manager at the National Association of People Living with HIV Australia.", "\"People who are diagnosed now should feel comfortable that the treatments will work and they will live a good, long life.", "\"I can think of a group of six friends, and I'm the only surviving person from that group. So that's kind of a heavy thing to carry along\".", "
When young gay men started dying of a mystery illness
", "It's been 40 years since AIDS was first identified as a disease.", "In June 1981, young, gay men in California and New York began suddenly dying of what appeared to be mysterious cases of pneumonia and a rare skin cancer.", "It would be years before the nexus of HIV and AIDS would be fully understood.", "However, by the time HIV was first identified in America, the disease had already arrived in Australia undetected.", "At the time, the country's gay rights movement was becoming more mainstream.", "Demands for equality, and freedom from discrimination, were being advanced from the earlier vanguards of LGBTQI visibility.", "Actor and dancer Robert Helpmann had become first openly gay Australian Of The Year in 1966.", "In 1969, Marion Paull and Claudia Pearce formed the country's first LGBTQI rights organisation.", "The outspoken Tasmanian doctor, conservationist, and senator-to-be, Bob Brown, came out in 1976 during an ABC television interview.", "Protests ranged from the stubborn to the gruesome.", "A group of activists in Sydney staged what they called a \"mardi gras\"\u00a0in 1978, marking International Homosexuality Solidarity Day.", "They were brutalised, named,\u00a0and shamed for daring to take to the streets.", "Richard Jessop demonstrated outside the surgery of a doctor who falsely advertised a \"cure\"\u00a0for homosexuality.", "Mr Jessop would offer slices of sheep's brains to passers-by.", "Just as the next generation of LGBTQI rights campaigners was entering the fray, HIV tethered their soaring spirits.", "People, particularly gay men at first, were dying suddenly. Social conservatives mercilessly declared it a sign of damnation from god or nature.", "\"In those early days, many people suicided rather than live with the diagnosis of HIV,\" Mr Rule said.\u00a0", "The trauma that galvanised the gay community in the 80s and 90s goes some way to explaining the disparity in education, diagnostic and support services for others living with HIV \u2013 women, heterosexual men, trans and Indigenous people, injecting drug users, sex workers, and those with other major comorbidities.", "\"Gay men had to be more educated because it affected us a lot more at the start,\" he says.", "John says it's taken a long time to make people understand HIV is not exclusively a \"gay disease\".", "\"Positive heterosexuals, women, people from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander backgrounds or any other group \u2014 they need their own space and their own networks, and they need the chance and opportunity to describe what their experiences are.\"", "
The importance of trust
", "Much of Australia's current COVID-19 test-and-trace expertise, especially in New South Wales, was built on systems first created to find and isolate chains of HIV transmission.", "", "
Professor Bill Bowtell says changing behaviours slowed the spread of the virus.
", "Professor Bill Bowtell is a health policy consultant who was one of the early architects of Australia's HIV/AIDS response.", "\"Unlike COVID where it quickly became apparent that you had it, this could stretch out sometimes months or even years,\" Professor Bowtell said.", "\"It wasn't just who you were with last week or last month, but who were you with over the entire period you might have been infectious.\"", "\"The question was, could you impede it by changing behaviour?\"", "\"The answer to that was, soon to be determined: Yes you could.", "\"But that meant getting gay men to change sexual behaviours, to use condoms, for injecting drug users to have clean needles and syringes, for sex workers to insist that clients wore condoms, and a whole raft of measures designed to greatly upgrade the sanitation in relation to blood transfusions, dentists, doctors, and reusable equipment. A whole raft of things.\"", "\"People had to have trust. They would not talk openly and honestly if they believed that information was going to be abused or handed to the police, or somehow going to involve them in being fined or getting into trouble.\"", "
Origins difficult to\u00a0pinpoint
", "Like COVID-19, the exact origins of HIV are difficult to pinpoint. It's likely to have been present in central African chimpanzees as far back as the early 20th century.", "Like Ebola and SARS, HIV in humans seems to have originated through unsafe consumption of wild bushmeat.", "Scientific models suggest it was largely contained to central Africa until urbanisation and mass human movement propelled it across the world.", "Since then, it's killed more than 30 million people, and it's still a major public health threat in many parts of the world \u2014 including Papua New Guinea and sub-Saharan Africa.", "It's an epidemic that UNAIDS, the United Nations program\u00a0on HIV/AIDS, is ambitiously aiming to end by 2030.", "But the head of UNAIDS, Winnie Byanyima said\u00a0there had been a lot of disruption due to COVID-19.", "", "
Head of UNAIDS\u00a0Winnie Byanyima says COVID-19 has disrupted HIV care.\u00a0(OxfamAU: James Henry)
", "\"We saw the numbers of people coming forward for testing decreasing the number of people picking up prevention tools such as condoms and PrEP [Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis] decreasing,\" she said.", "\"This is a time to warn the world that AIDS is still a pandemic.", "\"No one should get newly infected, no one should die. But there's a hoarding of the technology and know-how, and that's why there is scarcity.", "\"In Australia the rate of diagnosis has been between 1.3 and 1.9 times higher among Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people than Australian born non-Indigenous people.", "\"Factors of race, of sexuality, sexual orientation, even of illiteracy, education, unequal education standards, economic inequality all come together.\"", "The most recent data from 2019 estimates there are about 30,000\u00a0people in Australia living with HIV.", "Navigating disclosure of their positive status is a delicate undertaking in workplaces, friendships, families, and intimate relationships.", "Mr Rule said\u00a0many were thriving silently, or have the potential to, despite the burden of outdated stigma.", "\"If you are a person living with HIV and you are on antiretroviral therapies, then in sexual acts\u00a0you cannot transmit HIV to another person. That is a game-changer,\" he said.", "\"We now have a discussion in the community about quality of life,\" says Ruan Uys.", "\"I'm in a relationship with someone who's HIV negative and it's, you know, he forgets I'm positive until I joke about it."]
